programme.title: What Would You Do?
programme.desc: Using hidden cameras, host John Quiñones observes and comments on how ordinary people behave when they are confronted with dilemmas that require them either to take action or to walk by and mind their own business. Various scenarios are created that force people to make split-second -- and often surprising -- decisions, and variations of the situation (such as changing the genders, races or clothing of the people involved) are often featured to see if different reactions are elicited. Examples of situations on the show include a waitress being harassed by her boss, and a drunken valet trying to park cars.

Award-winning program anchored by David Muir, featuring unforgettable, character-driven true crime mysteries, exclusive newsmaker interviews, hard-hitting investigative reports and in-depth coverage of high profile stories.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Mac Jones completed 15 of 22 passes for 174 yards, with most of those going to Brian Thomas Jr. The first-round draft pick from LSU finished with seven receptions for 91 yards. His 11-yard TD catch with 7:05 remaining gave him his eighth game with at least 60 yards and a score, tying him with Hall of Famer Randy Moss for the most by a rookie in NFL history.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Washington Commanders quarterback Jayden Daniels ran for a season-high 127 yards, including 42 in overtime, and completed 24 of 36 passes for 227 yards and had two touchdown passes to Ertz and another to Olamide Zaccheaus to make the playoffs in his rookie year while casting a shadow over his rookie QB opponent in Michael Penix Jr.

programme.title: Mitchell Pehlke Lacrosse Show
programme.desc: Welcome to Episode 26 of the Mitchell Pehlke Lacrosse Show presented by Duke Cannon! Trevor Baptiste joins the show! He breaks down his journey with the Atlas, and if they have what it takes to win a championship this year. The boys breakdown week 7 craziness. Are the Outlaws the best PLL team in recent memory? Do the Cannons have an Asher problem? How are the Dogs planning on using CJ Kirst this late in the season? Doogs has an updated should've been MVP rankings. Kev breaks down the PLL challenge rule, as some seem confused on the matter. Brennan O'neill's ridiculous goal plays a part in this weeks Start Bench Cut.

programme.title: Doubles Poker Championship
programme.desc: Thirty-two of the best professional poker players in the world buy in for $50,000 apiece, but there's a twist. With $1 million in first place prize money at stake, which team will survive the gauntlet of clashing personalities and top shelf competition in a game that's usually a single-minded endeavor?

Kelly ventures into the area, only to be taken prisoner by the Sioux. Since Kelly saved the life of Chief Gall (John Russell) years before, the chief promises to free him if Kelly treats wounded Arapaho maiden Wahleeah (Andra Martin). Soon Kelly and the recovered Wahleeah are caught between Towns' soldiers and the vengeful Sioux.

programme.desc: Join Jeff and his outspoken felt pals: Walter, Peanut, José Jalapeño, Bubba J, and Sweet Daddy Dee for an evening of laughs and observations.

programme.title: Lavell Crawford: I Could Eat - Part 1
programme.desc: Lavell Crawford is back and here to contemplate how "My 600 Pound Life" could go for 15 seasons and he was still underweight, the kind of racist you have to be to not take a free holiday, and explosive consequences in a Taco Bell bathroom.

programme.title: Lavell Crawford I Could Eat Part 2
programme.desc: Meat's on the menu with Lavell Crawford keeping Burger King humble to their have it your way slogan, godless vegetarians, and why the best chicken is from a house of God.

programme.title: Lavell Crawford: New Look Same Funny! (Extended Edition)
programme.desc: Lavell Crawford, with a new look and new outlook on life, hosts a new standup special.

programme.title: Lavell Crawford: Home for the Holidays
programme.desc: The comic performs in St. Louis, discussing Christmas as a child, feeling guilty on Mother's Day, Thanksgiving and Disneyland.

programme.title: Lavell Crawford: The Comedy Vaccine (Extended Edition)
programme.desc: The Saul Goodman heavy takes his fifth stand-up special to Tempe, Arizona and he’s not holding back about anything—especially COVID-19.

programme.title: Traffic Jam Comedy Jam: Vol. 2
programme.desc: Marc Brissett teams up with Talent Da Comedian for hilarious standup comedy featuring Divine and Aldo Marachlian.

programme.title: Sinbad: Make Me Wanna Holla
programme.desc: A stand-up special covering the everything from the life advice his parents gave him to people with no talent having clothing lines and more.

programme.title: Sinbad: Where U Been
programme.desc: Sinbad hits the stage hard as he speaks truth to the burning subjects of the day, from poverty and politics to where he's been keeping himself.

programme.title: Tom Cotter: Rapid Fire
programme.desc: In this comedy special, the comic shoots jokes at the audience like a hilarious, quick-witted machine gun. Take cover. You've been warned.

programme.title: Tony Hinchcliffe
programme.desc: Tony Hinchcliffe comes to the stage and does stand up.

programme.title: Tony Rock: Rock The World
programme.desc: Description Unavailable

programme.title: Tuesday Thomas: Tuesday's Trash
programme.desc: Tuesday performs on stage, using her keen insight into the human condition to bring out the laughter.

programme.title: Wendy Liebman: It’s Wendy
programme.desc: Wendy Liebman delivers 45 minutes of pure gold, discussing things like pen pals, the magic of tidying up your space, and her goofy dogs.

programme.title: Corey Rodrigues: Not Complaining, Just Explaining
programme.desc: Corey Rodrigues discusses Patriots jerseys, angry Yankees fans and skinny fat guys with their shirts off.

programme.title: Jasmine Ellis: Black Girl Panic
programme.desc: Jasmine Ellis reflects back at the formative experiences that formed her adulthood; to the delight of a full house in Austin, Texas, Ellis looks back at her parents, experiences in a mental hospital and interracial marriage as a Texan.

programme.title: Matt Bergman: Mostly Nice
programme.desc: A mixture of new material sprinkled with some favorites from DC comedian Matt Bergman filmed in Dallas, Texas.

programme.title: Kai Choyce: Kaipocalypse Now
programme.desc: Kai delves into female orgasms as a porn category, how bigots need to pick a lane, the 2011 TV movie "Cyberbully," and plenty of other topics.

programme.title: Jay Mohr: Altamont
programme.desc: Comedian Jay Mohr tackles subjects from unexpected visitors, bringing up children to working with Chris Farley on SNL in his new stand-up special.

programme.title: Jay Mohr: American Treasure
programme.desc: The popular comedian tells deeply personal stories from his fascinating life and presents his famously funny celebrity impressions and observations.

programme.desc: Dan and Jackie take a road trip to a hardware wholesaler in Oklahoma; Darlene heads out of town and leaves behind a plethora of to-do notes for Becky and Ben.

programme.desc: Louise gets into a feud with Becky after accidentally sending a rude message in the family text thread.

programme.desc: Darlene figures out a plan to afford Mark's college tuition; Jackie and Louise try to help Becky meet a guy.

programme.desc: As Mark's graduation approaches, he considers his relationship with his father; Louise plans a big graduation ceremony at the Lunch Box.

programme.desc: Jackie faces problems at the Lunch Box and must take advice from an unexpected guest.

programme.desc: Becky introduces Tyler to Beverly Rose, but she is skeptical of Tyler’s approach.

programme.desc: Bev experiences moments of clarity and reflection and asks Jackie to spend the day together in Chicago.

programme.desc: Mark adjusts to his first day of college as a commuter student.

programme.desc: Darlene crashes Mark’s college trivia night to prove how smart she is.

programme.desc: Darlene urges Ben to make some male friends as he feels anxious about turning 50.

programme.desc: Darlene seeks to be manager of food services at Mark’s college after feeling they could use some organization.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners relish national cheeseball day. Harris falls behind in her work at the Lunch Box.

programme.desc: Dan is asked to write an article for a Hardware magazine, making Ben miss his days as a writer.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: A fire at Ben’s hardware store causes a major setback for the family.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan achieves a major financial milestone, reconsidering his belief in the ‘Conners curse.’

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Mark takes on odd jobs, determined to find a way to pay for school.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: A sudden turn of events forces the Conners to face their daily struggles in a way they never have before.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene is in for one surprise after another when David introduces his girlfriend, Blue (Juliette Lewis), and mentions that Mark and Harris will be spending the weekend with them.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: It's Halloween, the favorite time of year for the Conners, but an email from the school banning certain costumes, including Mark's, sets off an argument between Dan and Darlene.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Geena learns D.J. hasn't been taking Mary to church while she's been away, so she insists they go as a family.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: A family member drops a life-changing announcement; Dan suspects that Becky isn't sticking to her end of the deal about her drinking; Darlene continues her job search.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: With Mark and Mary's help, Jackie convinces Dan to build a chicken coop so the family can eat organic eggs.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan questions Peter's motives when he learns about the pricey Christmas gift Jackie bought for her new unemployed beau. Elsewhere, Mark and Mary write up their Christmas wish list.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When Becky helps Harris keep a secret from Darlene, it causes a split between the two sisters.

programme.desc: When Dan gets injured on the job covering D.J.'s vending machine route, the choice to sue the company could lead to D.J. getting fired.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When Ben offers Mark free piano lessons, Darlene finds this as an opportunity to test his parenting skills. Meanwhile, Jackie throws Becky a baby shower.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: As Darlene grapples with a life-altering offer, a conversation with David turns her world more upside-down.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: It’s no doubt that the ‘Ball Crusher’ Sweeper is the star of tonight’s show. With a brother- sister team hanging by a thread and a three-way hurdle, this week’s Sweeper writes itself into the History books. Tonight is also the night we meet Buffman, a pint sized Superhero with a twitch and a photo finish at the Dizzy Dummy threatens extinction to a Rare Breed. A week of action packed Wipeouts with Latin Dancing lotharios, what more can you ask for? And for the kids, a Fairy Tale, Wipeout Style!

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Showdowns don’t come more epic than this. Pro Wrestler Mikey takes on Wipeout Australias very own Tom Cruise. Its neck and neck through the qualifier which this week includes a real Mission Impossible, Dirty Balls. The trash talk is as fierce as the competition and continues to the Wipeout Zone with the winner taking not only the $20,000 but also the glory. Australia is also introduced to a new kind of “violent love”, the Fight Hug.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: This week contestants on Wipeout Australia are bought undone by a seemingly simple obstacle on the Qualifier, the Slippery Stairs. It’s all in the name really, an innocent set of stairs, covered in Wipeout Crash cream. Its up the way and down the way for all and sundry. The lucky 12 that move through, battle it out with a giant toothbrush Sweeper. ‘Nat with the Tats’ and Renee ‘Lets get physical’ move through to the Dreadmill, flying the banner for the ladies. Look out for Scotty Six Toes at the Big Balls and get the ear plugs ready as you meet Herr Chris. It’s a colourful week with leotards, laughs and lots of ladies.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: It’s Sitcom Central on Wipeout Australia with the Odd Couple, starring World’s Strongest Dwarf, David Clarke and Gentle Giant, Tim Watts. Once again the Big Balls deliver some spectacular moments with an Italian Chef being sliced and diced. Sacks are introduced at the Sweeper proving too much for some, but surprisingly helping the ladies to even things out as we go into a 50/50 male, female split in the Wipeout Zone.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Mesmerized by Bon Bon’s Belly Dancing, we catch up with our favourite Big Balls in the Qualifier. They dish out punishment to Australia’s very own female Jim Carrey and send Big Cat tamer Robbie into the pond. Goofy Goggles up the ante on the Dreadmill causing the Breakdancing Dad to create hilarious new moves. Golden Guns, Marisa battles it out for the ladies against Perfect Specimen, Seamus in the Wipeout Zone.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Wipeout Australia debunks the myth that only young, fit and funky people should go on game shows. This week we are forced to take notice of Demolition Dave, a 49 yr old South Australia man who thanks to some home training smashes the qualifier. For those lucky enough to survive the Fly Screen Sweeper it was Dizzy Dummy time. Emerging as the Dark Horse, Kobie Mulligan earned herself a shot in the Wipeout Zone, joined by a Strategist and Rubber Woman resulting in a bitter showdown.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: From singing Pastors to Wookies, this week is jammed pack with Characters, who battle it out on the Qualifier with amusing attempts at the inconceivable Field Goal Swing. Its no easy task to earn a spot in the Wipeout Zone this week with the Dreadmill, sorting the men from the boys. Contestants must dodge the wrecking ball while shooting basketballs. Although there is one man who came prepared, Dodgeball Champion Dan Bennett, whose “Duck, Dive, Dip, Dodge and Dunk” training comes into play.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: 20 Greatest Hits

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Fashion comes to Wipeout Australia as we meet Adam “God’s Gift” Marshall, a self styled Ad man who conquers the Qualifier. Other Catwalk moments include the Grandpa in his Red Speedos and a Rainbow Bright Personal Ad. If jumping a revolving arm while balancing on a pedestal above water isn’t enough for you then you’ll love this weeks Sweeper. Contestants are armed with Dodgeballs, to be deployed at each other, creating horrific hits and spectacular spills. The Dizzy Dummy claims its first victim as Dummy Tummy rejects a contestant and the Wipeout Zone becomes a battle of young and old.

programme.title: Shaq's Garage

programme.title: Shaq's Garage

While Bates, Himari, and Klaus are spending time with the new members, they find it difficult to relate to the new cars. The Paq must put aside their differences and work together in order to save Shaq from danger.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don visits the iconic garden of impressionist painter Claude Monet at Giverny. As well as revelling in the beauty and colour of Monet's paradise at this time of year, he has a privileged chat to Englishman James Priest, who, just this week, took up his role as head gardener of this world-renowned garden. Back at Longmeadow Monty shares his top tips for growing key culinary herbs.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don welcomes us to his garden at Longmeadow and offers some tips on keeping our gardens at their best throughout the season. Carol Klein meets wildlife enthusiast Steve Head, to discover more about the wildlife that depend on our garden ponds.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don looks ahead to the long Easter weekend by cutting back his grass borders. Meanwhile, Joe Swift reveals his top tips for creating a natural garden, and Carol Klein travels to Cornwall in search of a garden full of spring colour. Plus, the `living catalogue' of new and existing varieties of bedding plants at Ball Colegrave in Banbury, Oxfordshire.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At the height of summer it's time to ensure that fruits and vegetables are given attention to ensure maximum cropping. Monty gives advice on the summer pruning of fruit trees as well as showing how to get the best from tomatoes and chillies. He also recommends plants which will carry on flowering into Autumn.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: There are plans for propagating and planting at Longmeadow when Monty plants up a new bed of irises and takes pelargonium cuttings. Nick brightens up a dull and shady space at the side of a terraced house and gives advice on plants that will thrive.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gives advice on how to cut and maintain hedges as well as ideas on growing fruit in pots. Also, Nick Bailey travels to the southern tip of Cornwall to seek out a plant which escaped from our gardens.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As Monty brings in the summer harvest, he gives advice on what to sow to keep the crops coming up to the end of Autumn. Carol Klein visits a woman who is losing her eyesight and gives her recommendations of plants that will be a feast for her senses.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty propagates succulent plants, revisits his container vegetable garden, and gives advice on how to get a good crop of pumpkins. Adam looks a new garden at RHS Hyde Hall in Essex, and Rachel visits a garden of vibrant colours in Wiltshire.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the plants in the jewel garden reach the peak of their late summer glory, Monty starts planning for the spring when he plants ferns and gives advice on the care and maintenance of wildlife ponds.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty shows how to harvest and store potatoes. He also adds late summer colour to the cottage garden and prunes shrub roses. Carol Klein travels to Norfolk to meet Adrian Bloom, a member of a horticultural dynasty.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don takes a look at the use of pots and containers and revels in their versatility, practicality and potential and shows us how best to use them in our own gardens. Carol Klein returns to Stroud to see how the new gardeners are progressing.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the Wimbledon tennis championships just around the corner, Joe Swift meets the gardening team responsible for the spectacular floral displays at this world-renowned event.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don will be cutting back his delphiniums and adding a touch of the exotic to his Jewel Garden. Carol Klein is in Kent meeting lavender expert and breeder, Dr Simon Charlesworth, whose stunning walled garden is packed with many varieties of this beautifully scented plant.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don looks ahead to the long Easter weekend by cutting back his grass borders. Meanwhile, Joe Swift reveals his top tips for creating a natural garden, and Carol Klein travels to Cornwall in search of a garden full of spring colour. Plus, the `living catalogue' of new and existing varieties of bedding plants at Ball Colegrave in Banbury, Oxfordshire.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: July is a great time to get out and about visiting gardens, and this week, Monty Don travels to Cambridge for an exclusive tour of the gorgeous garden at Clare College. He'll also be catching up with various tasks at Longmeadow and, with luck, will be harvesting his first tomatoes.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost gives tips on lawn repair, grows some unusual vegetables and plants a seasonal container. Advolly Richmond brings us up to date in her history of lawns by exploring the trend for ever more sophisticated machinery.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Carol Klein and Joe Swift are at Gardeners' World Live in Birmingham. Joe will be casting an expert eye over the spectacular show gardens, while Carol will be focusing on the delights of the floral marquee.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: It's the Easter weekend, which means extra time to get out and enjoy the garden. At Longmeadow, Monty plants out sweet peas for summer colour, gives advice on what to use for mulching borders and has plenty of ideas for jobs to get on with this long weekend. Carol Klein is at RHS Rosemoor to revel in the floral spring sensations that epitomise the season. In Scotland, JJ Chalmers explains how important his local park was in helping both his physical and mental rehabilitation.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty shows how to prune and train the summer growth of climbing roses and makes the most of the seasonal warmth by planting perennials and sowing annuals. Frances Tophill visits a viewer's garden to give advice on how to prune unruly shrubs.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty begins the process of taking out plants which are in the wrong place and either moving or dividing others. He also gives advice on making leaf mould from fallen leaves and how to use it.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty revels in the sweet peas he grew from seed earlier in the year and shows how to keep their display going on into the weeks ahead. Meanwhile, Rachel meets a couple from Hampshire who have created their entire garden around their obsession for one plant, the hosta. Elsewhere, Carol travels to Wales to find out how one man tackled his sloping plot to make a garden on five different levels.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gives advice on how to cut and maintain hedges as well as ideas on growing fruit in pots. Also, Nick Bailey travels to the southern tip of Cornwall to seek out a plant which escaped from our gardens.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is busy ensuring that his plants are making the most of the warmth and light, and puts to use the homemade fertilizer he made a few weeks ago. He also catches up with his tomato growing trial to see how the different techniques are performing. Carol Klein gets to grips with flowering dogwoods, perhaps the most aristocratic and elegant of all garden trees, and there's a visit to a magical topiary garden in Kent.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don takes a look at the use of pots and containers and revels in their versatility, practicality and potential and shows us how best to use them in our own gardens. Carol Klein returns to Stroud to see how the new gardeners are progressing.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Longmeadow is in full bloom, but Monty Don is keen to remind viewers that there is still time to sow some late vegetables, demonstrating how easy it is to grow salad in a pot. It's time to give wisterias their summer prune. An expert, whose 252ft vine was in full flower just weeks ago, shows how she cuts back that summer growth. Meanwhile, Carol Klein has been out and about in Norfolk to revel in the bearded iris.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Carol Klein continues her journey across the nation in search of amazing plant combinations. This week, she's at Logan Botanic Garden near Stranraer famed for its colourful, exotic borders. Joe Swift drops in on a street in Bristol as the residents prepare to be judged by RHS Britain in Bloom.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the Wimbledon tennis championships just around the corner, Joe Swift meets the gardening team responsible for the spectacular floral displays at this world-renowned event.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don's garden at Longmeadow is thriving in the summer sunshine and is looking more beautiful by the day, but the warm, wet weather has meant the hedges are growing like crazy and are in need of a good haircut.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gets to work in his wildlife garden to ensure that there are plenty of plants in flower for early pollinators. Carol Klein meets Stuart Donachie who has embraced every planting opportunity in his shady garden in Herefordshire, and Frances Tophill invites viewers to grow easy summer vegetables along with her as she trials varieties for taste and productivity at RHS Rosemoor.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty presents a masterclass on growing Mediterranean herbs, plants lily bulbs for summer scent, and in the vegetable garden, he begins to sow seeds for salad root crops. Carol Klein is in Devon, where she takes a close look at late summer planting combinations. Meanwhile, in Cumbria, there's a gardener whose passion for exotic plants and dahlias has taken over his family garden and spilled over onto his allotment.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The first big gardening weekend of the year gets underway with Monty dividing perennials and giving plenty of tips for how we can kick-start the garden for the season ahead. As millions of bedding plants are poised for planting in our pots and borders, Joe Swift visits a major grower to find out how they are produced and what drives the demand.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don visits the iconic garden of impressionist painter Claude Monet at Giverny. As well as revelling in the beauty and colour of Monet's paradise at this time of year, he has a privileged chat to Englishman James Priest, who, just this week, took up his role as head gardener of this world-renowned garden. Back at Longmeadow Monty shares his top tips for growing key culinary herbs.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the holiday season well and truly upon us, Monty shares some timely tips on how to make sure your garden doesn't suffer while you are away. But there are some gardeners that daren't leave home, as Joe Swift discovered when he met Phillip Vowles.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Carol Klein is with Billy Carruthers in West Lothian, enjoying his wonderful and varied collection of flamboyant peonies. Joe Swift visits world-renowned opera venue Glyndebourne in Sussex and is given an exclusive tour of their gardens.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty's thoughts turn to spring when he gives recommendations for bulbs to plant that will thrive in pots. He also shows how to prune summer fruiting raspberries. In Norfolk, Frances Tophill visits a gardener who at 97 still gardens every day.

programme.desc: Mark Peterson finishes the South America Waterfowl Slam in the Andes at 15,000 feet elevation. With only 2 days left, he is able to capitalize on every opportunity and take the remaining 6 species needed on the list of 20. It's been an incredible journey, and it all comes down to this!

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, hunting season swiftly coming to an end. Withthe real estate world getting busier, Slade and his family set outto fill some tags, and fill up the freezer. It’s time to go on a DoePatrol!
Chris Schmidt and his son Hunter go after some big east coast bucks and a whopper of a bruin before closing out the season in Kansas.
Joe Miles – Owner of Asio Gear, chases big whitetails in Kentucky, Kansas and Mexico!

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Will Cooper finally trades 3 years of tough times for triumph in his quest to tag an out-of-state buck with a bow.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Join Will Cooper on an unforgettable adventure in the Colorado mountains, where he dedicated three years chasing elusive bull elk without success. Determined to turn the tide, Will enlists the expertise of his good friend Jermaine Hodge, prior World Elk Calling Champion and Wrestling Coach for the United States Army World Class Athlete Program. Together, they face challenges and overcome adversity during a thrilling public land over-the-counter rifle hunt. Experience the highs and lows of their journey against the stunning backdrop of Colorado's wilderness.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: It’s the opening week of rifle camp and everyone is ready to go. Big Hoss has a close encounter with a big eight point and Cody finds himself having a little Déjà vu when a big buck walks out into the same plot he killed in last year.

programme.title: The Raven Project - "Raven Whitetails"
programme.desc: Catch all of the deer that have hit the dirt over the last few seasons on The Raven right here.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: While Randy and Dustin are trying to get the farm ready for Fall plots and create new access trails, Cody is at the river living life to the fullest. Randy finally has had enough and is doing something about Cody’s lack of effort on the farm.

programme.title: Behind The Draw
programme.desc: The Hunsucker boys have grown up immersed in the bowhunting lifestyle and are now finally of age to hunt themselves. Mike, Kamden and Noah are all 3 trying to catch up with bucks in their home state of Missouri.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 2: New Orleans, Josh links up with Mason Hereford (owner of award-winning sandwich shop Turkey and the Wolf) and then hits the road for some epic hog hunting, swamp fishing, crawfish and oyster harvesting, and exploring Louisiana’s only water buffalo dairy farm. It all culminates in one incredible feast featuring unique regional dishes prepared by Mason with the help of some local friends.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: New. York. City. That’s where our host Josh Rosen kicks off his journey in Episode 4—and where he lived for 16 years and started up the surf-centric apparel brand, Saturdays NYC. Back in his old stomping grounds, Josh first meets up with the award-winning chef and Mumbai native, Chintan Pandya, currently blowing up the New York food scene with his unapologetic and authentic Indian cuisine (pro tip: try the goat brains). Next, Josh travels through the boroughs, heads upstate, and along the coast to source local ingredients—from sake brewers and pig farmers to catching fresh lobster just 100 miles from Wall Street. As always the adventure will end with a feast, right back in Chintan’s kitchen.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: Hop in the float plane—a new episode of DIRT just dropped. The DIRT crew made their way to Alaska, “the land of earth, sea, and sky.” All feast, no sleep is the name of the game as Josh makes the most of Alaska’s abundant and legendary daylight alongside local guides, fishermen, and even a couple grizzlies. There’ll be plenty of time to hibernate in winter. But for now—join us—there are halibut to filet, rainforest ’shrooms to forage, and mountainside meals to cook up.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: From fuzzy velvet to hardened bone, antlers are more than headgear—they're nature’s calendar. In this episode of Deer & Deer Hunting, we explore the fascinating stages of whitetail antler development, what they reveal about a buck’s age and health, and how understanding this process can help you become a better hunter. Join us as we break down the biology, bust myths, and show real examples from the field.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: Can the everyday landowner really manage their property well enough to hold and retain mature bucks year after year? From habitat improvements and food plots to pressure control and property layout, discover what truly influences a buck’s decision to stay—or stray.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: In this in-depth episode of Deer & Deer Hunting TV, the team explores what it truly takes to implement an advanced food plot strategy. We go beyond the basics, walking viewers through soil science, crop rotation, plot placement, and how to integrate food plots into a larger habitat management plan.

Del Stewart (William Holden), is the only one aware of the surrender attempt. programme.desc: When a list of undercover CIA agents is stolen, the team enlists the help of Magnum, Higgins, Rick and TC to get it back and protect national security; Higgins gives Tani some personal advice.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: Grover and the team investigate a murder at a private golf course involving a man who was frozen to death in the locker room's cryotherapy chamber; McGarrett tags along with Danny when he tracks down the father of a boy who has been bullying Charlie.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: Soon after Danny meets the girl of his dreams, they get into a potentially fatal car accident in an area far from help; McGarrett enlists Quinn and Tani to help when Eddie the dog suddenly shows signs of post-traumatic stress disorder.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: When Grover's niece goes missing from the police academy, it's discovered that her boyfriend is an undercover member of the yakuza.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: On Valentine's Day, Tani and Noelani are held hostage during a convenience store robbery; the team investigates the murder of a Thai diplomat whose wife confesses to the crime, but Danny suspects she's covering for the real killer.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: Harry Langford helps Five-0 investigate some murders that follow the plot of a fabled, unpublished crime novel from the 1920s; Tani and Junior's friendship takes a meaningful new turn.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: The team investigates a murder on a cargo ship where pirates impersonated the Coast Guard to board the boat; Adam finally gets the evidence he needs to take down the island's Yakuza operation once and for all.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Could a ballad made famous by late, lamented folk singer Johnny Carver be an inspiration for murder? Did someone want to kill Toby Winning for threatening to take the Little Crosby Folk Festival away from Midsomer - or is the true motive something hidden for 20 years?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The fizz goes out of a sparkling wine launch when the glasses are laced with slug poison. Who is targeting the Midsomer Vinae Winery and what does the attack have to do with the death of a child in a hit-and-run accident?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: New DCI John Barnaby arrives in Midsomer and is bemused by the quaint villages and their quirky residents. But when a local DJ is crushed to death at a traditional girls' boarding school, he soon discovers that murder and deception are never far away. As the death toll rises, could Barnaby's first case also be his last?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The reclusive lives of elderly eccentrics William and Mary Bingham (Edward Fox and Phyllida Law) comes under police scrutiny when a social services investigator (Jeff Rawle) is murdered. Barnaby and Jones must unearth generations of family secrets and decipher astronomical charts to find the killer.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When a young woman is dressed like a bride and drowned in a bath, it triggers a spate of ghoulish wedding-themed murders in Great Worthy. The case takes Barnaby and Jones to a donkey sanctuary, a heritage steam railway and a pub run by an ex-copper and former brothel madam. With the serial killer still at large, could history be repeating itself?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Jones goes undercover at the Oblong Foundation after one of the cult's young female members disappears suddenly. But he and Barnaby soon start digging into an old case involving the death of a couple in a boat explosion.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: In Midsomer Mow, the gruesome discovery of a farmer's eviscerated body in an ancient stone circle is made just days before the spring equinox.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A VAT inspector goes missing as he hunts for an illicit cider still responsible for brewing The Beast, a potent local hooch. At the Midsomer Abbas spring fayre which celebrates its friendship with Midsomer Herne, Barnaby and Jones sample the local cider, while temperance preacher Norman Grigor calls on residents to repent of their drunken ways. Suddenly, Barnaby is violently ill as the body of missing man Peter Slim is found floating in the cider vat. Meanwhile Samuel Quested (Warren Clarke), the traditionalist mayor of Midsomer Abbas, seeks to revive the ancient rite known as 'The Stag'.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby and Jones investigate the cloistered world of Midsomer Priory when a nun is strangled to death. The detectives uncover a complex mystery involving holy orders, teenage romantic liaisons, African art and missing antique silver as the community is forced to open its doors to 21st-century policing.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A row between keen birdwatchers in Midsomer-in-the-Marsh turns nasty when their president is killed. Patrick Morgan met his death while hoping to sight a rare bird, but is his obsession with ornithology to blame - or something more sinister?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When MATTHEW DRAPER, a quarry worker is killed by a demolition charge after obeying the orders of his foreman, IAN FRASER, to return to the unexploded device, no one can predict how it might effect the tranquil village of Fletcher's Cross nine years later...

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby's aunt, Alice Bly (Phyllis Calvert), has an addiction to detective stories, a deep admiration for her favourite nephew, and is recovering from an operation at the Lawnside Nursing Home. When a resident dies, Alice Bly picks up gossip which, mixed with the detective fiction with which she is passing the hours, makes her think that all is not as it should be at Lawnside.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The village of Midsomer Mallow is one of the villages hoping to win the title of the "Perfect English Village" competition. As the story unfolds, not everything is "perfect" as local thief Peter Drinkwater is stabbed with a pitchfork at an abandoned farm, he's using as a squat. Shortly after robbing a retired actor's home. Despite the villagers' best efforts to keep the murder quiet so as to not ruin their chances in the competition, several further deaths occur eventually bringing Detective Chief Inspector Barnaby back several decades to uncover the killer.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Whilst the Upper Marshwood hunt assemble outside the village inn, a filthy tramp-like man leaves the shop and skulks into the wood. Soon after, he hears the sound of the hunt begin and the unforgettable noise of the horses and hounds in hot pursuit of the fox. Running for cover, towards the safety of his home-made shelter, he stumbles and falls into a pit - screaming. LIZA, isolated in the disused railway carriage which constitutes her home, moves deeper into the wood having heard the scream. She finds the pit and sees the tramp lying crumpled on the ground, clearly dead. She stares at him for a moment, then turns and walks away.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A disused airfield near Morton Fendle is the location for a romantic evening between young Simon Bright and his girlfriend Laura Sharp - absolutely nothing could ruin their date. The next morning, when Frances Kirby is out for her morning jog, she notices the vintage car they were in up at the airfield, containing Simon Bright's dead body, with Laura nowhere to be seen. Confused, Detective Chief Inspector Barnaby and D.S. Jones can't work out whether it was a suicide pact or murder. Furthermore, they've got to find Miss Sharp and their investigation leads them to linking Simon and Laura with the villagers of Morton Fendle, who met at Elaine Trim's dancing classes. Eventually, the Barnaby family plus Jones make it to a 40s style dance night at the village hall before more villagers start turning up dead.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When Faith Alexander arrives in Midsomer County to meet her long-lost uncle Rex Masters, she gets a shock - Rex's staff had been told that she was dead. Things become even more complex when Rex's body is found in a nearby river, bearing wounds that suggest he was murdered. Barnaby and Jones are soon on the case, trying to establish who would have wanted the elderly man dead. Several people soon come forward with multiple wills, which confuse the matter, but when two more people, close friends of Rex, are also murdered, the investigation raises question on the motive, leading Barnaby to wonder if it was down to finances, passion, or something from Rex's past.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny builds a world-class bike for a high end client, and if all goes well it could mean a ton of new business for the shop.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: The local Fox News channel is looking to update their Ford Expedition Storm Chaser in the coolest way possible.

programme.title: Counting Cars

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny's friend Brian has always wanted to ride a motorcycle, but has never been able due to his physical limitations.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny takes on a Route 66-inspired Chevy for the famed highway's biggest fan, and later teams up with his good buddy, American Restoration's Rick Dale.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny wants to fix up and flip a 1978 Lincoln Continental Town Car. That is, if he can bring himself to let it go. Then, the crew transforms a 1954 Oldsmobile Rocket 88.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Kevin and Roli make an unplanned stop to check out a mysteriously small vehicle. And later, Danny gets a call from Rob Zombie who wants to customize a truck for his upcoming tour.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: The shop has its hands full with a custom psychedelic bike, and Danny's infamous friend.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny has no interest in a rubber-to-roof restoration on a `73 Chevy Blazer until he hears that it's a tribute to the owner's nephew.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny has a last-minute change of heart and can't let go of a classic car he promised to sell to a loyal customer.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: When Danny challenges the guys to come up with innovative money-making ideas for the shop, Shannon proposes building a bike.

programme.title: Counting Cars

programme.desc: Chumlee from Gold & Silver stops by to pick up his custom 1963 Lincoln, but gets some really bad news instead.

programme.desc: Danny and Horny Mike get too close for comfort when they convince a Model-T Hot Rod owner to let them take it for a spin. Later, a Soap Box race car brings out the inner child in Roli and Mike.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Kevin is won over by a hotrod pick-up truck, Danny tracks down a customer's original 1969 Firebird but its terrible condition may make it impossible to restore.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Pawn Stars' "Old Man" Mr. Harrison stops by Count's Kustoms with a job that is as unique and old fashioned as he is.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Ryan and Kevin head to the Bonneville Salt Flats to see The Turbinator, a vehicle that holds a land speed record try to break 500 MPH.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: A customer wants to trick out his 2004 Harley Davidson Road Glide, but both Shannon and Ryan aren't sure they can do everything he wants.

programme.desc: Legendary rocker George Lynch from the metal band Dokken stops by with his very cool 1965 Buick Riviera.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The loggers barely survive in a plummeting market; the Gustafson bosses have a close call; an old hook-tender returns to the Browning team, halting Jesse's rise to management; Pihl loses a crucial member of the team.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Some loggers have more reasons to be grateful than do others as Thanksgiving arrives; the Pihl crew loses men to illness; the Gustafson crew's younger members blow off steam; the season's first snowfall bodes a warning for the Stump Branch crew.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The loggers race to stay one step ahead of a storm approaching the Oregon coast; Jesse pushes his crew to meet their deadline; muddy roads trap Stump Branch trucks; Robby battles for control; lumber market slump.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Some crews shut down while others struggle to stay afloat after stormy weather arrives with a vengeance; the stalled housing market hits home for the loggers.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The news of upcoming layoffs worries the men; Gustafson Logging tries to get back on track; Browning races to meet a big deadline; Pihl Logging is under pressure to finish its Pig Farm job.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Two of Oregon's logging giants, J.M. Browning and Gustafson Logging, fight to survive; Jay Browning must make tough decisions; smaller outfits find winning strategies.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The gap widens between winners and losers at the halfway point of the season; Stump Branch tests a dangerous logging strategy; the Pihl men play while the bosses are away; a mistake by the Gustafson crew may end a man's career.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The Gustafson crew faces a nearly impossible deadline; half the Pihl crew skips work; Stump Branch mistakes and inexperience put profits and lives at risk; Jay Browning makes a troubling discovery about his next job.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The worst storm in 25 years pummels the Oregon coast, turning the town of Veronica into a flooded disaster area; Jay Browning is nowhere to be found; Darrell must act fast to save his house from falling trees.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The loggers try to put the storm behind them and get back to work; Darrell makes a startling discovery; Stump Branch greenhorn Michael goes missing; Jay struggles to muster his troops without phone service; the Pihl crew bails out one of its own.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The battle is far from over as logging's toughest season winds down; Jesse questions the future of the family business; rumors of a pullout abound for the Gustafson crew; the Pihl crew celebrates a good year; a Stump Branch logger quits.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick sees red when a Rolex Submariner hits the counter; Corey gets slap happy over a hockey stick signed by Paul Newman; Chum and Santos are sweet on a set of Mr. Softee trading cards; Rick heads to the range to see a set of Bolivian thunder mugs.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A seller brings a Mr. T wall clock to the shop; Rick checks out James Bond's prop credit card from the 2006 movie "Casino Royale"; Corey plays with an Atomic Cannon toy; a 1940s Stoner vintage candy machine; a signed Salavador Dali cookbook.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Things get scary, when a seller comes in with a letter from Stephen King; Chum gets a sweet lesson when he checks out signed Steve Aoki merchandise; Corey pays lip service to a Harrison family tradition when a James Bond poster comes in.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: When a customer walks into the shop with a signature worthy of presidential praise, Chum heads to a prop house in L.A. to reflect on some historic Hollywood items; a magician has a car once owned by Siegfried and Roy.

programme.desc: Rick hangs 10 as he checks out a rare playing card featuring a legendary surfer; Chum heads to the range to check out a "Yellow Boy" carbine; Corey looks through a collection of items from Van Halen's "Hot for Teacher" music video.

programme.desc: A friend swings by to show Rick and Chum a star-studded collection of photos; a vintage LP of the single "We Are the World" spins into the shop; Chum and Santos give each other a hand, when they check out an ancient Chinese cannon.

programme.desc: Willie puts Little Will on a budget for his first car but it backfires when Will decides to get a motorcycle instead.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: While many of the guys' wives and children are in Africa doing charity work, Willie and Jase get into a debate over tracking ability which leads to a challenge--can Jase and Si track and capture Willie and Jep?

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: With Korie still in Africa, Willie and Jep must step in and supervise Bella's sleepover. When a couple boys play a prank on the girls, Willie and Jep prove to be the perfect chaperones for the task.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: It's all hands on deck for the Duckmen when an old high school nemesis challenges them to a good old fashion race... at the local lawn mower competition. But Willie and the guys soon find out that this sport is nothing short of high octane.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: With Sadie's (Willie's daughter) driver's license test fast approaching, she finds herself in dire need of lessons.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After Willie's son (John Luke) leaves Willie's pickup in the driveway with a bone-dry gas tank, Willie and Korie decide that it's time to get the kid his own car.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The Duck Commander assembly room gets an unexpected shakeup when a disgruntled Si decides to quit his job. But when Willie hires a replacement that clashes with the duck call room, Jase and the guys quickly become equally miserable at work. Meanwhile, Si turns to Phil for work out on the land turning a routine levee repair into a complete disaster.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie finds his office in shambles and alerts the authorities that the warehouse has had a break in. But soon Willie discovers that the culprit was his brother Jase, who needed supplies for an early morning frog hunt.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When a heat wave envelops West Monroe the air conditioning unit at the Duck Commander warehouse goes down, turning the duck call assembly room into a boiling sweatshop.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After Korie decides the junk piles in the Duck Commander warehouse are beginning to reach critical mass, she calls on Willie and the guys to do a little company spring-cleaning. But the discovery of an old Ping-Pong table deep within the clutter quickly turns the chore into an all day table tennis tournament. Meanwhile, Uncle Si realizes that he's many years overdue for an appointment with the local eye doctor and ventures out for some new glasses.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie and Jase run against each other to become president of their neighborhood HOA. Jep, Jess and Miss Kay work on a Duck Commander themed display for the local zoo.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie buys a 3D printer for the office that starts off as a fun distraction for the guys until it appears the printer could soon replace their jobs. Si, upset that Willie invested in the 3D printer and didn't give him a raise, invests in John Luke's Sno­Cone stand.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jase, Jep, Si and Cole try to fight back a growing population of cottonmouth snakes on Phil's property. Meanwhile, Willie uses his business expertise to help Rebecca improve her clothing store.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie puts Little Will on a budget for his first car but it backfires when Will decides to get a motorcycle instead.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: While many of the guys' wives and children are in Africa doing charity work, Willie and Jase get into a debate over tracking ability which leads to a challenge--can Jase and Si track and capture Willie and Jep?

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: With Korie still in Africa, Willie and Jep must step in and supervise Bella's sleepover. When a couple boys play a prank on the girls, Willie and Jep prove to be the perfect chaperones for the task.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: It's all hands on deck for the Duckmen when an old high school nemesis challenges them to a good old fashion race... at the local lawn mower competition. But Willie and the guys soon find out that this sport is nothing short of high octane.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: With Sadie's (Willie's daughter) driver's license test fast approaching, she finds herself in dire need of lessons.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After Willie's son (John Luke) leaves Willie's pickup in the driveway with a bone-dry gas tank, Willie and Korie decide that it's time to get the kid his own car.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Korie challenges Willie to come up with a romantic gesture without spending any money. Missy and Jase compete to see who can find a girlfriend for Mountain Man.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jase's hopes to win the inaugural Duck Commander Fishing Tournament is buoyed when he is able to enlist the help of legendary angler Bill Dance. Meanwhile, Willie's vanity over his greying beard leads him to make a questionable decision.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jase and Jep make a deal with Mia and Merritt to get them to go dove hunting with them. Si tries to make some extra cash by starting a West Monroe tour.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jumping Asian carp have invaded Monroe's waters so Jase and the guys set out to try to stop them from spreading further. Meanwhile, Willie and Si have to run Willie's Duck Diner for the day.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The family spends a weekend at their childhood summer camp, reliving old memories and working to repair a tennis court Willie built twenty years ago. While at the camp, Jep tries to pass a lifeguard swimming test he failed as a teenager.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Rowdy's adoption is finalized and he officially becomes a Robertson. Jase gets his first massage and enjoys it more than he expected.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After Willie and Jase lose Si's tea cup, Si makes them go to great lengths to find it. When the entertainment for Gus's 1st birthday party falls through, Jep fills in as a magician.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie, Korie, Jase and Missy take dance lessons from Sadie to prepare for Reed and Rebecca's upcoming weddings. Jase's plan to perform Reed's wedding ceremony may fall through when he waits until the last minute to renew his ordainment.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Si decides to retire to pursue a music career, the family organizes a party in his honor. Meanwhile, Willie, Phil and Jase take a road trip to try to recreate an old duck call for Si's retirement gift. (Surprise performance from ZZ Top!)

programme.desc: A 1937 International Harvester gets a big old Cummins 12-valve diesel engine that's as heavy as the truck itself; a 2005 Chevy Colorado gets a new lease on life as a nitrous-infused drag truck.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: A 1996 dump truck is the largest truck the shop has ever customized; the guys go extra heavy duty to create a military-styled megatruck; a lowrider enthusiast wants a custom air ride and LS swap for his pristine 1934 Buick.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: This year's over-the-top build has Bill and crew lifting a 2020 Chevy Silverado 5500 more than a foot with a custom heavy-duty air suspension; the guys also prove their Texas mettle by radically overhauling the utility bed.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: HOF running back Earl Campbell arrives with the parts of a 1949 Cadillac,

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: NFL Hall-of-Famer Earl Campbell made a career mowing down defenders, so the guys take the same hell-bent approach to rebuilding his 1949 Cadillac; they also customize a van for a disabled motocross rider so he can drive again.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: The team revamps an old school '34 Buick into a modern day lowrider; after months of rebuilding the body and making a custom frame for Earl Campbell's '49 Cadillac, the Hall of Famer challenges the shop with a last-minute wrinkle.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: A long-time client wants to improve upon a near-perfect '68 Ford Ranger; the team is up to the task with an all-new custom chassis, handmade interior, rebuilt bed and Coyote 5.0 engine swap; the guys check off new custom upgrades on a '75 Bronco.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: A 1996 Impala throws the guys for a loop when they discover it's an imposter; the team makes it better than ever, with custom body fabrications, rear subframe and handmade interior.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Truck builds tend to get bigger than originally planned, so it's no surprise when a 1971 Suburban goes even bigger with a custom lifted air suspension and interior; a nearly finished 2006 Kodiak needs just one more custom upgrade.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Bill and his team make one of their longest custom chassis ever for a new 2020 Denali, and Ekstensive gets a diesel pro-mod drag car back on the track.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Ekstensive turns a stock 2020 Denali dually into a frame-dropping, show-stopping work truck; as a final touch, Bill handmakes articulating speakers for the bed; Bill takes a family's minds off their brush with a custom 2019 Polaris Ranger.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: The guys bring a 1964 Lincoln back with a late-model Coyote engine and handmade interior; the Sling-Ray is a custom automotive sensation, but Ekstensive has what it's been missing.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: A 1971 Suburban returns to the shop for "phase two," wanting more power and custom metalwork; when a client finds parts and pieces of a '68 C10, Bill and the crew set on a new course for a ground-up build.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: The ice is right! Following two short seasons, the drivers are ready for what is forecasted to be a cold and busy winter.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: The ice road season is off to a bad start. Legendary trucker Alex Debogorski gets more than he bargained for when he falls through a patch of thin ice.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: Darrell Ward faces a trail nicknamed the obstacle course. Todd Dewey struggles to clear a melting ice bridge.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: On her first ever solo trip, Polar rookie Steph Custance braves one of the longest ice crossings on the winter roads map. An engine fire stops Lisa Kelly dead in her tracks.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: Alex Debogorski confronts a creek that's thawed in the middle of the road. On an important run for Polar, Art Burke receives news that could be devastating.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: As the end of the record short season nears, Polar Boss Mark Kohaykewych makes an historic deal with rivals Darrell Ward and Lisa Kelly.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: The historic four truck convoy faces fire and a crossing so thin, they must test the thickness themselves.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog's got a twofer on his hands, but the cases couldn't be more different. The first is a woman whose family wants her back in jail, the other is a former choirboy whose family ties are strong.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Roger has 27 prior arrests, spent years in jail and doesn't want to go back. But he's missed court and now Dog has to bring him in.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: With twelve kids of his own Dog knows how hard it is to keep children on the straight and narrow, especially during their turbulent teens.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Cecily has graduated from High School and Dog believes the time is right to show her what the family business is all about. The rough and tumble world of bounty hunting is very different than the all girls private school.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog finds himself fighting two enemies--the law and his inner demons. He continues his legal battle to fight extradition to Mexico in connection with his 2003 capture of fugitive rapist Andrew Luster. His other struggle is private.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: "When you don't write the bond, you don't know the prey," as Dog always says. So when Dog and team help out a bondsman friend whose client jumped bail, the target is a blank slate. Are his tattoos gang related? Is he likely to be violent?

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Facing hard time for forging checks, Melissa pulled a vanishing act at her sentencing hearing, bolting from the courthouse in broad daylight. Lucky for her bondsman, Dog and his posse are in Colorado and ready to help.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: A Hawaiian surfing hero is on a wave to nowhere and it's Dog's turn to play lifeguard. "Buttons," known throughout the islands for his prowess on the waves and his daring 360's, has wiped-out on the rocky shoals of drug addiction.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog is busy. First he's after a fugitive who is allegedly an expert in the game of "burn and return"--shoplifting goods to return them for cash refunds. But he's not easy to track.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog knows that it is better to give than to receive, so when a fellow bondsman grieving for his recently departed spouse requests his help, he jumps into action. Studying the fugitive's file the team uncovers a surprising fact.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Going after two fugitives in one day is tough enough without the facing Colorado's notoriously unpredictable weather. Today it's the threat of sever thunderstorm, hail and area wide tornado warnings.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: It hurts Dog to see people who after years of walking the straight and narrow, suddenly lose their way. But today's case is a member of the law enforcement community who has recently gone astray, and that truly troubles the Dog.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog told him not to go, but Charles went anyway, skipping to Oregon against the terms of his bail. Now Dog has a tip that Charles plans to slip back into Honolulu. With $30,000 on the line Dog knows he can leave little to chance.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: What looks like a routine pick-up turns into a complicated case of betrayal, deceit, as well as quality nail care as Dog and company track down an fugitive alleged to be an abusive boyfriend with one too many friends in his close knit community.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and Beth take time from their busy schedule to thank their fans by inviting them into their home to celebrate the holiday season. But when Dog decides he needs to help his son Garry believe in Santa Claus again the plan changes.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog's target for today has been in trouble with the law since he was a juvenile. And he seems willing to use any trick in the system to avoid capture by Dog. In this match of wits, will Dog prevail?

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog is back in Denver and in hot pursuit of a woman wanted for identity theft. The sad reality is that the identify which has been robbed is her own. She's traded in a bright future for a life on the wrong side of the law.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Today the team isn't pulling any punches, literally or figuratively! In between tracking down a potentially dangerous ex-con facing a five year stretch in the big house, Leland is struggling to find time to train.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Being hunted by the Dog is a lousy way to celebrate your birthday but that's exactly the spot that Robert finds himself in today. He's missed his court date, quit his job, and vacated his last known address.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: It's Dog's birthday, and he plans to celebrate in the same way he has for the last twenty years. There's no taking the day off to indulge himself for this bounty hunter--he's tracking down a fugitive!

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: The "Big Island" of Hawaii boasts both lush tropical splendor and stark volcanic beauty. But today Dog and the team can't spend much time taking in the sights, they need to help Leland hunt down some elusive fugitives.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog knows that crime and drugs not only damage victims but also harm the families of the perpetrators, especially the kids. And both of the fugitives he's chasing today have left shattered families and struggling women in their wake.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog just can't resist a challenge, especially if it's to help out a friend. Jim is a bondsman and longtime friend of Dog. Jim's son has just started in the family business.

programme.desc: The search for a missing mother of two during Hurricane Harvey.

programme.desc: Authorities search for the killer of an A-list fashion writer who left her fast-track career and moved to Cape Cod, where she became the town's first murder victim in 30 years.

programme.title: 48 Hours
programme.desc: A military veteran finds himself facing murder charges for beating his girlfriend to death; now, doctors suspect his traumatic brain injury and PTSD explain his behavior.

programme.title: 48 Hours
programme.desc: When a woman disappears, no one reports her missing for months until she misses an appointment with her hairdresser.

programme.title: Someone They Knew With Tamron Hall
programme.desc: In 2001, University of South Carolina student Shelton Sanders disappeared while planning a friend's bachelor party; he was never seen again; when evidence leads to an arrest, however, prosecutors are left with a tall task.

programme.title: Someone They Knew With Tamron Hall
programme.desc: When Vicki Beckham was found dead in her car on the side of a mountain road, with very little evidence, police called it almost the perfect crime; but a series of clues blew the case open, taking them from a strip club bouncer to a Bishop's son.

programme.title: Someone They Knew With Tamron Hall
programme.desc: Divorce wasn't enough to end the animosity between James and Linda Cooney; the bitterness continued until Linda shot James dead with a .357 Magnum; she claimed self-defense, but the only witness was their 10-year-old son.

programme.title: Murderous Affairs
programme.desc: Two murder cases where the victims are found in parks in New Jersey.

programme.title: Murderous Affairs
programme.desc: Two murder cases involving cheating spouses with evil minds in Pennsylvania.

programme.title: Murderous Affairs
programme.desc: A married soldier begins a dangerous affair; a Canadian wife ends a life.

programme.title: Murderous Affairs
programme.desc: A newlywed wife with a violent ex-husband in Washington State and in Lisburn, Northern Ireland, a Fire Chief wants to extinguish a love rival.

programme.title: Murderous Affairs
programme.desc: A Kentucky airline pilot is murdered for money; in the UK, a former pro-golfer is attacked by his wife's lover.

programme.title: Murderous Affairs
programme.desc: In Washington, a husband goes missing; killer swingers in the UK.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: Beginning in summer of 1990, the bodies of several women began turning up in and around the city of Vienna, Austria. From an extensive investigation by the Viennese police, it was determined that these murders were the work of one sadistic predator. Europe was dealing with a serial killer. With no experience with this kind of predator, Viennese police turned to the FBI. FBI profilers were able to identify a suspect in the murders. More ominously, they linked this same killer to murders committed in the United States.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: A 1981 armored car robbery near New York City left one guard dead and another critically wounded. Police stopped suspects nearby and another shoot-out ensued, claiming the lives of two officers. Local police and the FBI suspected a large group of domestic terrorists with a history of violent crime. They would try to ferret out these heavily armed criminals who moved in a shadowy underworld and were not afraid to kill authorities.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1986, a small crime free Indiana town was turned inside out by the arrival of one dangerous stranger. After an officer was gunned down at point-blank range, the psychotic killer led investigators across the Midwest. No one knew where the gunman would strike next, even as his tally of murders and abductions grew. The FBI and state police raced against time to rescue America's heartland from this deranged gunman, before he killed again.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: When violent criminals strike, the FBI strikes back, employing every available resource, and creating new ones when necessary. From forensic science to criminal profiling, specialized intelligence to global fugitive tracking, the agents of the FBI battle the bad guys with a most powerful arsenal: the crime-fighter's toolbox. This special episode of The FBI Files celebrates the groundbreaking science, investigative technique, and gut-level instinct that has made the FBI the world's premier law enforcement agency.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: When a California man was found dismembered in 1990, police suspected a local burglar, but they couldn't find him. Six months later, he was caught robbing an Arizona bank and sentenced to life. But prison couldn't hold him for long, and within a year he escaped. The FBI would lead a multi-agency manhunt for a killer on a desperate run through the tourist regions of the west.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In October 1993, a robber surprised unsuspecting customers by dropping through the roof of a California bank. When police arrived, he escaped from the roof in a hail of bullets. A tip from a local resident led police and FBI agents to the perpetrator. They would soon learn that he had masterminded a local kidnapping, and held the fate of an innocent woman in his hands.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: By April of 1995 in Washington, D.C., two officers had been shot and one had been murdered. Each had been sitting in their patrol cars when a man sneaked up and opened fire. The FBI was brought in to help catch the cop killer. Agents identified the man who was most likely the killer, but he was nowhere to be found. Months of surveillance operations around the country finally yielded a break; they found their suspect in Baltimore, MD.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: This is the story of the FBI's first capture of an international Lebanese terrorist. In June 1985, the terrorist and his four accomplices hijacked Royal Jordanian flight #405 shortly before take off in Beirut, Lebanon. On board were American citizens, a professor and his teen son. The FBI opened a criminal investigation and worked with various other government agencies to form Operation Goldenrod, a task force specifically charged with bringing the terrorist to justice in 1989.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: Residents of the small town of Noel, Missouri were shocked when one of their banks was robbed. When the bank president was nowhere to be found, the residents were outraged. The FBI discovered that things are not always as they appear. Minute clues led the agents to the body of the bank president. With no suspects, the FBI relied on dogged determination and modern forensics. Agents slowly pieced together tiny shreds of evidence.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1997, FBI agents began investigating New York gas station mogul Gurmeet Dhinsa for gas pump rigging. They soon realized that Dhinsa was more than a crooked businessman, he enforced his mob-like operation with brutal violence, kidnapping and killing errant employees and any family members who questioned their deaths. FBI agents worked their way into Dhinsa's violent world.

programme.title: Los Archivos del FBI (Doblado)
programme.desc: El primero de octubre de 1993, un extraño secuestró a Polly Klaas de doce años durante una piyamada en su casa. El FBI de inmediato entró en el caso. Los agentes reunieron fibras de su habitación y descubrieron, a través del uso de fuentes de luz láser, la huella de una palma en la cama de Polly, previamente invisible al ojo humano. Después de una extensa investigación de dos meses, el FBI arrestó a Richard Allen Davis. La impresión de la palma y las fibras coincidieron y Davis fue condenado por secuestro y asesinato.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: At 9:30 am on the morning of January 30, 1997, Richmond, VA police respond to a report of shots fired at a local bank. Two masked men brandishing automatic weapons confront, and open fire on officers responding to the call. The gunmen exit the bank, and retreat on foot, eventually eluding the officers. The FBI soon responds, only to find one bank teller dead, another wounded, and the bank's security guard shot four times, yet still alive.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: California Highway Patrolman George Gwaltney discovered the body of 23-year-old Robin Bishop near her car on a remote desert highway. Although he proclaimed his innocence the FBI lab experts were able to link tool marks found on the frame with tools found in Gwaltney's home. Through the match of hairs and fibers and a unique test for detecting and identifying sperm, Gwaltney was placed at the scene of the crime.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the late 70s and early 80s, a terrorist group known as the FALN is suspected of setting off bombs in major U.S. cities. Their goal - to bring attention to the Puerto Rican independence movement. As the bombings escalate, innocent lives are lost. FBI agents and police are is in a deadly race to stop this murderous group with a dangerous cause.
